Chapter 2
Global Server Load Balancing
Global Server Load Balancing Overview

front.div:
Global Server Load Balancing (GSLB) enables a ServerIron ADX to add intelligence to authoritative Domain
Name System (DNS) servers by serving as a proxy to the servers. As a DNS proxy, the GSLB ServerIron ADX
evaluates the server IP addresses in the DNS replies from the DNS for which the ServerIron ADX is a proxy.
Based on the results of the evaluation, the GSLB ServerIron ADX can change the order of the addresses in the
reply so that the "best" host address for the client is on top.
NOTE: The server no-remote-l3-check command disables Layer3 health checks of IPs learned through GSLB.
NOTE: You need to increase max virtual servers to 1024, max real servers to 2048, and max ports to 4096 to
use the max hosts/zone feature.
Do not increase following when use max zone/host feature, or you will run out of memory:
system-max ip-static-arp 4096
system-max l3-vlan 4095
system-max mac 64000
system-max ip-route 400000
system-max ip-static-route 4096
system-max vlan 4095
system-max spanning-tree 128
system-max session-limit 1000000
system-max virtual-interface 4095
